title: What's really going on in software
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.growthunhinged.com%2Fp%2F2025-saas-benchmarks-report%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019a820c038d-b319874a-5a9f-4eaa-8930-9e791f181b1d-000000/D_skk-2Np5goII0T5izOZqjrIfaAJS1ZmexhGT-9Z3E=431
summary: What's really going on in software (7 minute read) SaaS metrics have stabilized while AI-native companies grow far faster and reshape productivity across the industry. The strongest growth appears in companies with AI at the core.

title: In Search of the AI Bubble's Economic Fundamentals
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Reading time: 10 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.project-syndicate.org%2Fonpoint%2Fwill-ai-bubble-burst-trigger-financial-crisis-by-william-h-janeway-2025-11%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019a820c038d-b319874a-5a9f-4eaa-8930-9e791f181b1d-000000/gQuHZwqnBXS9RL5lhWcWv5q6FqqQVa5RncRtqlmpT-4=431
summary: In Search of the AI Bubble's Economic Fundamentals (10 minute read) AI investment is racing ahead of real returns, creating classic bubble conditions. Most enterprise pilots aren't working yet. True productivity gains may only arrive after today's hype inevitably deflates.

title: Why Being Capable Doesn't Get You Promoted
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Reading time: 3 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fnews.yuezhao.coach%2Fp%2Fwhy-being-wickedly-smart-and-capable%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019a820c038d-b319874a-5a9f-4eaa-8930-9e791f181b1d-000000/YpmZzBNHGs-KiBPxoNld-gIfGayMNKOeSTZYDBxyjIM=431
summary: Why Being Capable Doesn't Get You Promoted (3 minute read) Promotions in leadership depend on business need, not performance alone. The fastest path upward is finding teams with real openings and growth.

title: The Lenses
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Reading time: 5 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fcutlefish.substack.com%2Fp%2Ftbm-387-lenses%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019a820c038d-b319874a-5a9f-4eaa-8930-9e791f181b1d-000000/Qy-uKG-Rb8qpZJMkTB5KGzSXfmovvopP1K065h-LHts=431
summary: The Lenses (5 minute read) A systems map contains many lenses, but someone must choose which ones matter. Ops succeeds when it brings clarity, not complexity.

title: How to ship a mobile app
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.productparty.us%2Fp%2Fpart-2-how-to-ship-a-mobile-app-aka%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019a820c038d-b319874a-5a9f-4eaa-8930-9e791f181b1d-000000/fjqajS5zvLU5Y0PDenbeMfXvMG-kWgcfLMUp-LrRuQ0=431
summary: How to ship a mobile app (aka The Submission Gauntlet) (7 minute read) Launching mobile apps is harder because Google and Apple require real testing, real feedback, and real judgment. The challenge is not building the app but navigating people, process, and product choices.

title: AI Marketplaces
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Finsights.euclid.vc%2Fp%2Fverticals-4-ai-marketplaces%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019a820c038d-b319874a-5a9f-4eaa-8930-9e791f181b1d-000000/LNo-5Bu2BswI1PmQqCOmZCYHFIWQRYp6fKjj0AUPrMs=431
summary: AI Marketplaces (74 minute podcast) AI makes marketplaces faster, but trust and local expertise still win. ACV Auctions proves that buyer-first trust, clean data, guarantees, and regional depth are what truly scale vertical platforms.

title: Tinder to use AI to get to know users, tap into their Camera Roll photos
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Reading time: 12 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Ftechcrunch.com%2F2025%2F11%2F05%2Ftinder-to-use-ai-to-get-to-know-users-tap-into-their-camera-roll-photos%2F%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019a820c038d-b319874a-5a9f-4eaa-8930-9e791f181b1d-000000/8jUTCFTRKy1qpCf4DjQCMdEEOcs9q9peq9UidOTJEKY=431
summary: Tinder to use AI to get to know users, tap into their Camera Roll photos (12 minute read) Tinder's new AI matching feature relies on scanning users' photos, but the privacy cost seems higher than the benefit. Despite rolling out fresh AI tools and redesigns, the app continues to lose subscribers in a tougher dating market.

title: The biggest model update this week
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Reading time: 8 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.news.aakashg.com%2Fp%2Fthe-biggest-model-update-this-week%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019a820c038d-b319874a-5a9f-4eaa-8930-9e791f181b1d-000000/749rJQWR2EmBizE8a_DdMw26BYXeB5yYgJlHjsC40uw=431
summary: The biggest model update this week (8 minute read) Kimi K2 brings open-source to frontier quality through self-correcting reasoning, beating GPT-5.1 on real-world product decisions. GPT-5.1 now focuses on warmth and tighter instruction-following, making interactions feel friendlier and more reliable.

summary: Apple Aims to Capitalize on Mini App Trend With New Program (4 minute read) Apple's new Mini Apps Partner program gives Apple a 15% cut of in-app purchases for mini apps and games within larger 'super apps'. The new program should help lock those software creators into Apple's preferred approach and guarantee more revenue for the company. The New Glenn booster is considerably bigger and heavier than SpaceX's Falcon 9 booster.

title: Generative UI SDK for Flutter
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fflutter%2Fgenui%3Futm_source=tldrnewsletter/1/0100019a821afbe5-aa7739b6-3cbe-4d58-bb50-bc5b12c4aacc-000000/rOy7WG_UXcNPKDi5d2ceoiFchbBUneekXq-IKO4V8jw=431
summary: Generative UI SDK for Flutter (GitHub Repo) GenUI (Generative UI SDK for Flutter) is a Flutter library that lets developers easily add interactive generative UI to their applications. It is designed to help developers replace static walls of text from large language models with dynamic and interactive graphical UIs. It can turn conversations and agent interactions into rich, intuitive experiences. State changes in the UI are fed back to the agent, creating a high-bandwidth interaction loop.

comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-14, Reading time: 8 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.avitalbalwit.com%2Fpost%2Fthe-advice-i-would-give-on-a-mentorship-call%3Futm_source=tldrnewsletter/1/0100019a821afbe5-aa7739b6-3cbe-4d58-bb50-bc5b12c4aacc-000000/KycP1PcuYT_DXcYULUV8t9XXNe38GMowz7Qjpg5U7ok=431
summary: The advice I would give on a mentorship call (8 minute read) The most helpful mentors are usually folks who are only a few years ahead of you. A person who is a decade ahead may be in an objectively more impressive place, but someone nearer to your stage will have experienced an environment that is much closer to your own. This post contains advice for college freshmen seeking mentorship on managing their time and looking for their first job.
